channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report E-2024040508
item.description:
Report E-2024040508

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-22
  • City: SALINA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XAE experienced a UN2920 Bulk Strip 881 release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-quart of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a pinhole puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The impacted trailer floor was cleaned and neutralized with Fabuloso and Oil Dri. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (2) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024041094
item.description:
Report X-2024041094

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-18
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE I WAS DOING MY DOCK WALK IN THE MORNING, I NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS ON ITS SIDE AND UP AGAINST THE WALL CLOSEST TO THE DOOR FOR THE TRAILER. AS I GOT CLOSER AND TIPPED THE PACKAGE UPRIGHT, I NOTICED A WET SPOT ON THE PACKAGE. I GRABBED A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. I MADE SURE THERE WAS NO RESIDUE ON THE FLOOR AS I MOVED THE PACKAGE AND BROUGHT IT BACK AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024040823
item.description:
Report X-2024040823

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: TOPEKA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET PACKAGE BROUGHT TO QA FOR INSPECTION UPON INSPECTION FOUND IT TO BE A HAZMAT REMOVED FROM HIGH TRAFFIC AREA OPENED TO FIND 1 BOTTLE OF Hydrogen peroxide and peroxyacetic acid mixtures WITH A LOSE CAP CAUSING CONTENTS TO SPILL OUT INTO THE BOX DescribePack: LOSE CAP BOX LOOKS LIKE IT WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AT 1 POINT DurationRel: 9 and MitigateEffect: REMOVED FROM HIGH TRAFFIC AREA AND PUT IN A YELLOW HAZMAT TUB

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When the manager opened the trailer, she noticed a spilled and she called QA. DescribePack: the container got punctured and spilled out about 1.5 gallons. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA went to the area and cleaned the spilled and brought all the damaged package to the processing cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040767
item.description:
Report X-2024040767

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER WAS PULLING OFF THE BELT, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS WET AND INFORMED THEIR MANAGER. THE MANAGER QUICKLY INFORMED QA OF THE POSSIBLE LEAKING HAZMAT SINCE THE PACKAGE WAS WET. QA GRABBED A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG AND FOLD ABSORB. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE PACKAGE IN QUESTION WAS LEAKING CORROSIVE MATERIAL. THEY PLACED THE PACKAGE IN THE TOTE. QA CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB MATERIAL. ONCE IT WAS SAFE AND SECURE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS ON ITS SIDE ON THE IC BELT AND CAUSED THE 5-GALLON CONTAINER TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB.
